so_67509678: bash --init-file thatfile

arg="$1"
cat >thatfile <<EOF
$(declare -p arg)
script.sh \"\$arg\"
EOF
bash --init-file thatfile

su_1437790: pass command line arguments in a bash script
Top-3 Scripts: so_65825618: cat asnlookups_domains_ip.txt | awk '{print $1}' | xargs -n1 amass intel -whois -d

su_1437790: ssh -t "name@$server" "sudo awk -F= 'FNR == 2 {print \$2}' /etc/version.txt" < /dev/null > ~/version

remote_command="sudo awk -F '=' 'FNR == 2 {print \$2}' /etc/version.txt"

readarray -t servers < ~/hosts
for server in "${servers[@]}"; do
    ssh -t name@$server "$remote_command"
done > ~/version

paste ~/hosts ~/version > ~/ip_and_version
